subject: Re: [junit] Code Coverage Analysis Tool
msgSnippet: ­ ­Try Clover. It provides a fully integrated plugin for NetBeans and will work in the situation you describe. You can get a free eval download at:
messageBody:
­
­Try Clover. It provides a fully integrated plugin for NetBeans and will
work in the situation you describe. You can get a free eval download at:

http://www.thecortex.net/clover/

[Disclaimer: I work at Cortex, the maker of Clover]

Regards,
-Brendan
http://www.thecortex.net/clover/

¸¤M wrote:

> My team is developing an API, which is not an executable program
>
> I would like to ask are there any code coverage analysis tools can be
> integrated with JUnit and NetBean?
>
> I've tried Rational PureCoverage and JCover, but they both requires
> an executable test script......so how can I use these tools to
> integrate with the test scripts written for JUnit?
>
> Thanks in advance.
>
